title: How many Presidents of the United States were Republicans? - Quora
tags: Specific Presidents of the United States of America
Presidential History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: As of 2018, there have been 19 Republican presidents. Abraham LincolnUlysses GrantRutherford HayesJames GarfieldChester ArthurBenjamin HarrisonWilliam McKinleyTheodore RooseveltWilliam Howard TaftWarren HardingCalvin CoolidgeHerbert HooverDwight EisenhowerRichard NixonGerald FordRonald ReaganGeorge H.W. BushGeorge W. BushDonald TrumpI see that the other two answers include Andrew Johnson as a Republican. I think that’s nonsense. He spent his entire life as a Democrat, and when Lincoln tagged him to be his running mate in 1864, they called their ticket the “National Union” ticket to show that they were trying to unite Democrats like Johnson and Republicans like Lincoln. And Johnson never called himself a Republican.

20, from Lincoln to Trump. Lincoln, A. Johnson, Grant, Hayes, Garfield, Arthur, Harrison, McKinley, T. Roosevelt, Taft, Harding, Coolidge, Hoover, Eisenhower, Nixon, Ford, Reagan, Bush Sr., Bush Jr., and Trump. Although Andrew Johnson’s party affiliation was really Democrat, but since he ran with Lincoln, he often gets considered as a “Republican.” John Quincy Adams was a “National Republican,” successor to the Federalist Party, and predecessor to the Whigs, which turned into the modern day Republicans. Also, Jefferson, Madison and Monroe were “Democrat-Republicans” sometimes called anti-Federalists or just “Republicans. Maybe add in 4 more “Republicans” Grand total: maybe up to 24. Or less precisely, somewhere between 19 and 24 presidents were “Republicans” of some kind.
